"We think it is going to go to Apollo next week."

column5: WASHINGTON Verizon Communications Inc  said on Thursday it has a "reasonable basis" to believe Yahoo Inc's massive data breach of email accounts represents a material impact that could allow Verizon to withdraw from its $4.83 billion deal to buy the technology company.

column4: UPDATE 3-Verizon says Yahoo hack 'material ' could affect deal
column5: WASHINGTON  Oct 13 Verizon Communications Inc  said on Thursday it has a "reasonable basis" to believe Yahoo Inc's massive data breach of email accounts represents a material impact that could allow Verizon to withdraw from its $4.83 billion deal to buy the technology company.

column4: CORRECTED-Verizon believes Yahoo email hacking 'material ' could affect deal
column5: WASHINGTON  Oct 13 Verizon Communications Inc  general counsel  Craig Silliman  said on Thursday the company has a "reasonable basis" to believe that Yahoo Inc's  massive data breach of at least 500 million email accounts represents a material impact that could allow Verizon to withdraw from its $4.83 billion deal to buy Yahoo.

column4: UPDATE 3-Verizon closing call centers in five U.S. states  3 200 jobs affected
